message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.CR 

This paper deals with natural language processing and machine learning techniques to extract relevant information from large volumes of text data. Specifically, it focuses on risk mining and multi-document extractive summarization, which are sub-fields of computational linguistics and information retrieval. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). Additionally, the paper also involves techniques such as autoencoding and selection algorithms, which are related to artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and machine learning (cs.LG). Finally, since the paper deals with identifying and summarizing risks, it may also be relevant to the sub-category of computer security and cryptography (cs.CR).
